thread.title: Syracuse native Andray Blatche leads Philippines to semifinals of FIBA Olympic qualifier
thread.title_full: Syracuse native Andray Blatche leads Philippines to semifinals of FIBA Olympic qualifier | syracuse.com

author: Donna Ditota | dditota@syracuse.com
title: Syracuse native Andray Blatche leads Philippines to semifinals of FIBA Olympic qualifier
text:
Syracuse, N.Y. â€” Andray Blatche, the Syracuse native and naturalized citizen of the Philippines, has led that nation into the semifinals of the FIBA Asia championship, which will be decided in China this week.
Blatche scored 24 points and grabbed 17 rebounds to lead the Philippines to an 82-70 win over Lebanon today. The Philippines now plays Japan on Friday in the tournament semifinals. The winner of the FIBA Asia tournament earns an automatic invitation to the 2016 Rio Olympic Games.
Blatche, who attended Syracuse schools before transferring to South Kent to finish his scholastic career, immediately entered the NBA upon his high school graduation. He played for the Washington Wizards, who used the NBA's amnesty clause to part ways with him, then played for the Brooklyn Nets before deciding to embark on a lucrative overseas career. He is now playing in China.
Blatche is averaging 17 points and nine rebounds in about 24 minutes of play in the FIBA Asia tournament. He has, throughout his career, offered a blend of shooting and scoring ability that defies his 6-foot-10 size. Blatche is apparently playing this week with a sore ankle.
